data.name: EDDN - Nürnberg Montag
data.short_description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week.
data.description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week. It's always a great mixture of mainly holiday-bound mid-range airliners, VFR traffic buzzing through the CTR, a bunch of cargo traffic and business as well as medical flights in smaller jets and props. Not to forget the regular military transports in larger airliners for the close-by Grafenwoehr training area. Pick up your charts, find an IFR route that suits you or just jump into your favorite flying lawnmower and explore the beautiful Franconian countryside with its tons of small airfields to choose from.

data.name: Zurich Night
data.short_description: Welcome to the Zurich Night, the weekly onlineday of Switzerlands major airport! Every Tuesday from 1730z to 2030z, expect full staffing, professional and friendly ATC service and plenty of traffic.
data.description:
Welcome to the Zurich Night, the weekly onlineday of Switzerlands major airport! Every Tuesday from 1730z to 2030z, expect full staffing, professional and friendly ATC service and plenty of traffic.


Enjoy one of total 4 IFR approaches or get yourself a spot as a small VFR aircraft between the big birds. VFR flights are still performed regularly despite the airport's size. This makes flying VFR to/from Zurich extremely interesting, but it's also a huge challenge which requires careful preparation. A lot of small airfields in the vicinity offer numerous possibilities for short VFR hops.


Zurich is a unique airport with a lot of operational restrictions due to noise abatement and its challenging layout. We know it by heart and love this airport with all its rough edges. And we are sure you gonna love it as well!


Almost every Tuesday we will also staff Geneva (LSGG) and Basel (LFSB) for you with our Trainees. Check out the bookings on vacc.ch.


Join our frequencies every Tuesday evening and enjoy!


Airport information, Scenery & Charts
LSZH - Zurich


Routes
Find valid routings on routes.vacc.ch.
Still looking for a destination? We recommend Berlin Brandenburg (EDDB) (18:00-20:30z) and the Adria Region (18-21z).

data.name: Gatwick Midweek Madness
data.short_description: VATSIM UK is happy to invite you back to our weekly Midweek Madness rotation! Join us this Wednesday between 1700-2000z at London Gatwick.
data.description:
VATSIM UK is happy to invite you back to our weekly Midweek Madness rotation.


This is the first week of the rotation, and as such we are returning to Gatwick; home to some of Europe's largest airlines, including British Airways, easyJet, Ryanair, TUI, and Virgin Atlantic - there's something for everyone. Whether you'll be doing a 30 minute hop to Jersey or an 8 hour flight from the Caribbean, you can expect nothing but the best from our air traffic controllers. Expect plenty of land-after clearances and be hard on the brakes, as Gatwick's single runway is pushed to capacity.


Midweek Madness takes place from 1700-2000z every Wednesday, following the rotation below:



  • London Gatwick

  • Manchester

  • London Heathrow

  • Feature Week (Open to vote)
    The event always proves to be a hit with pilots and ATC, we hope to see plenty of you joining us on the localiser this Wednesday.

data.name: VACC-Austria Weekly Wednesday
data.short_description: Weekly Wednesday - every Wednesday - 1730-2030z - FULL ATC in Austria
data.description:
Enjoy extended coverage of FULL ATC across the entire country. Take your favourite aircraft out of the hanger for a spin to our majors Vienna (LOWW) and/or the infamous Innsbruck Airport (LOWI). Alternatively enjoy a flight to our breath-taking minors: Salzburg (LOWS), Graz (LOWG), Klagenfurt (LOWK) or Linz (LOWL). Of course, we are providing full CPDLC and PDC service along the way!


Take a break from your busy schedule and enjoy an evening with 3 hours of guaranteed ATC-service "as real as it gets"! We are very excited to welcome you to one of our airports!

data.name: Geneva - One by One
data.short_description: Last Friday night of the month? Put your kids to bed or place them in the right seat and start your engines, as vACC Switzerland launches the latest addition to its event catalogue at Geneva International Airport (LSGG).
data.description:
Last Friday night of the month? Put your kids to bed or place them in the right seat and start your engines, as vACC Switzerland launches the latest addition to its event catalogue at Geneva International Airport (LSGG).
With a single concrete runway, controllers face the challenge of getting the timing just right, in order to clear you to land just seconds after departing traffic’s gear has left the ground. Needless to say, expect late landing clearances.


Waiting at the holding point? Get ready to line up behind landing traffic or execute a rolling takeoff, for there is bound to be traffic on final awaiting that late landing clearance.


We are up for the challenge, fully staffed and ready to get you in and out safely,** one by one**. Look out for the chain of landing lights on the ILS in Geneva, every last Friday of the month from 1800z to 2000z.


Scenery & Charts
LSGG - Geneva


Routes
Find valid routings on routes.vacc.ch.

data.name: LPPT - Lisboa Real Ops 2021
data.short_description:
Lisboa Real Ops 2021 is the 13th edition of what is the biggest annual event in Portuguese Airspace.
On September 25th, pilots are invited to choose from one of the 169 flights on offer, connecting Lisboa to 67 airports! Book your slot at: https://realops.portugal-vacc.org
data.description:
Lisboa Real Ops 2021 is the 13th edition of what is the biggest annual Event in Portuguese Airspace.


It's the coming together of some of VATSIM's finest pilots and controllers with an amazing scenery in the background. Lisboa Airport is known for its beautiful approach over the heart of Portugal's Capital.


On Saturday September 25th, pilots from all over the world are invited to choose from one of the 169 flights on offer, connecting Lisboa to 67 airports spread across 5 continents.


Book now your slot [https://realops.portugal-vacc.org/]here)! Together with the flight number, you will get an updated and valid route to ensure your experience is as smooth as possible.


To the pilots with DCL capable aircraft, Lisboa has introduced Clearance via Data Link earlier this year, so you may request your IFR clearance either through voice with Delivery, or via DCL with logon LPPT.


Please note that if you book a flight but cannot attend, you must send an e-mail to EVENTS@PORTUGAL-VACC.ORG cancelling your reservation so that others can take the slot instead.

data.name: EDDN - Nürnberg Montag
data.short_description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week.
data.description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week. It's always a great mixture of mainly holiday-bound mid-range airliners, VFR traffic buzzing through the CTR, a bunch of cargo traffic and business as well as medical flights in smaller jets and props. Not to forget the regular military transports in larger airliners for the close-by Grafenwoehr training area. Pick up your charts, find an IFR route that suits you or just jump into your favorite flying lawnmower and explore the beautiful Franconian countryside with its tons of small airfields to choose from.

data.name: Moncton Monday [09/27]
data.short_description:
Moncton Monday is VATCAN’s longest running weekly event, providing full-coverage ATC every Monday night, beginning at 23h00z, encompassing over six terminal controlled airports, and dozens of smaller fields.


All kinds of traffic are welcome. Come fly our friendly skies!
data.description:
Moncton Monday is VATCAN’s longest running weekly event, providing full-coverage ATC every Monday night, beginning at 22h00z, encompassing over six terminal controlled airports, and dozens of smaller fields.


Each Monday, airports including Halifax (CYHZ), Moncton (CYQM), St. John’s (CYYT), and Gander (CYQX), will be staffed from top to bottom, in a fun and relaxed Monday night.


All kinds of traffic, whether VFR or IFR, airplane or helicopter, are welcome and pilots of all skill levels are invited.


Come and fly our friendly skies!

data.name: Zurich Night
data.short_description: Welcome to the Zurich Night, the weekly onlineday of Switzerlands major airport! Every Tuesday from 1730z to 2030z, expect full staffing, professional and friendly ATC service and plenty of traffic.
data.description:
Welcome to the Zurich Night, the weekly onlineday of Switzerlands major airport! Every Tuesday from 1730z to 2030z, expect full staffing, professional and friendly ATC service and plenty of traffic.


Enjoy one of total 4 IFR approaches or get yourself a spot as a small VFR aircraft between the big birds. VFR flights are still performed regularly despite the airport's size. This makes flying VFR to/from Zurich extremely interesting, but it's also a huge challenge which requires careful preparation. A lot of small airfields in the vicinity offer numerous possibilities for short VFR hops.


Zurich is a unique airport with a lot of operational restrictions due to noise abatement and its challenging layout. We know it by heart and love this airport with all its rough edges. And we are sure you gonna love it as well!


Almost every Tuesday we will also staff Geneva (LSGG) and Basel (LFSB) for you with our Trainees. Check out the bookings on vacc.ch.


Join our frequencies every Tuesday evening and enjoy!


Airport information, Scenery & Charts
LSZH - Zurich


Routes
Find valid routings on routes.vacc.ch.
Still looking for a destination? We recommend Berlin Brandenburg (EDDB) (18:00-20:30z) and the Adria Region (18-21z).

data.name: Manchester Midweek Madness
data.short_description: VATSIM UK is happy to invite you back to our weekly Midweek Madness rotation! Join us this Wednesday between 1700-2000z at Manchester.
data.description:
VATSIM UK is happy to invite you back to our weekly Midweek Madness rotation.


This second week of the rotation takes us up North to Manchester. This is a major hub for Ryanair and easyJet, so has plenty of short connections to Europe as well as domestic links in the UK. It also sees a large amount of international flights from the likes of Emirates, Singapore Airlines, Saudia, and Virgin Atlantic. Our controllers will be online to guide you in or out of one of Manchester dual parallel runways!


Midweek Madness takes place from 1700-2000z every Wednesday, following the rotation below:



  • London Gatwick

  • Manchester

  • London Heathrow

  • Feature Week (Open to vote)
    The event always proves to be a hit with pilots and ATC, we hope to see plenty of you joining us on the localiser this Wednesday.

data.name: VACC-Austria Weekly Wednesday
data.short_description: Weekly Wednesday - every Wednesday - 1730-2030z - FULL ATC in Austria
data.description:
Enjoy extended coverage of FULL ATC across the entire country. Take your favourite aircraft out of the hanger for a spin to our majors Vienna (LOWW) and/or the infamous Innsbruck Airport (LOWI). Alternatively enjoy a flight to our breath-taking minors: Salzburg (LOWS), Graz (LOWG), Klagenfurt (LOWK) or Linz (LOWL). Of course, we are providing full CPDLC and PDC service along the way!


Take a break from your busy schedule and enjoy an evening with 3 hours of guaranteed ATC-service "as real as it gets"! We are very excited to welcome you to one of our airports!

data.short_description: Join BVARTCC on September 29th from 7-10PM ET (23-02Z) for a Regional Circuit between Boston and Burlington. See you there!
data.description:
In the Regional Circuit, we staff up two of our airports to provide pilots with an opportunity to receive 'gate-to-gate' ATC service for the duration of the event. Pilots are encouraged to fly between the two airports and make the return flight if time allows; however, traffic from other airports is welcome as well. The Regional Circuit always creates an immersive atmosphere with busy frequencies and congested airways between the host airports.


This Regional Circuit features Burlington (KBTV) and Boston (KBOS).


It’s also a great time to try out one of our WINGS flights. Remember, many of the flights have published Alternate Airports, allowing you to earn your BVA pilot ratings at event airports!

data.name: Stuttgart Thursday EDDS
data.short_description: Prepare for Stuttgart Thursday! No matter whether you are flying a small plane or a jet, IFR or VFR, if it flies it is welcome here.
data.description:
Prepare for Stuttgart Thursday! No matter whether you are flying a small plane or a jet, IFR or VFR, if it flies it is welcome here. From 20:00lcl to 22:00lcl (18:00z to 20:00z in the summer and 19:00z to 21:00z in the winter) there will be a mix of old stagers and new trainees controlling for you. Fly from Stuttgart over the Swabian Jura, to Lake Constance or follow the Neckar to the Rhine. As destination for your IFR-Flights we would recommend Hamburg, where RG Bremen is performing Hamburg Thursday and you can almost be sure of full ATC coverage.


Charts: https://vatsim-germany.org/pilots/aerodromes/EDDS

data.name: Hamburg Thursday
data.short_description: The "Hamburg Thursday" crew looks forward to see VFR oder IFR pilots from all over the world at every thurdsday ... Welcome to Northern Germany's busiest airport!
data.description: Every Thursday there are many options for flights in northern Germany. Perhaps you choose a VFR flight to Bremen or the Frisian Islands? For those who prefer to fly IFR, we recommend Stuttgart as a destination. Online day is also there on Thursday and enroute ATC is very often guaranteed. But Munich, Frankfurt, Berlin or Amsterdam are also within reach for an evening flight.

data.name: Cross the Land: Eastbound 2021
data.short_description: After a little break since our previous Westbound 2021 event, the Cross the Land planning team is excited to announce that the event is back heading Eastbound on October, 2nd 2021!
data.description:
Welcome to Cross the Land: Eastbound 2021!
After a little break since our previous Westbound 2021 event, the Cross the Land planning team is excited to announce that the event is back heading Eastbound on October, 2nd 2021! For more updates and developments regarding the event be sure to follow our social media accounts to receive these updates on the go!


Cross the Land is gaining popularity on the network as VATEUDs and VATMENAs signature event between the two major divisions. As our previous editions the aim to to bring the two divisions closer than before and give the most coverage to pilots along the event routes!


Cross the Land: Social Media Accounts
You may find several of our social media accounts below to keep yourselves updated on the progress of the event below:



  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/vatsimctl

  • Discord: https://community.vatsim.net or joinable via direct invite link here: https://discord.gg/4b7XEpZ


Cross the Land: Development Updates
With the event more than 106 days away from now we will release further updates regarding the different stages of the event such as airport voting, booking and so forth within this forum thread and our social media platforms mentioned above. We cannot wait to see you on the 16th of October 2021!

Welcome to Slovak Online Day happening every single Wednesday! You can expect whole Slovakia online! Bratislava Mr Štefánik LZIB, Poprad Tatry LZTT and Košice LZKZ will be online. You will meet friendly controllers, 100% ATC coverage over Slovakia and we don't care, if it's IFR or VFR, everyone is welcome!


About Slovak Online Day: -Starting event from 17:00z to 20:00z every Wednesday -Full ATC coverage in Slovakia -Friendly Slovak controllers will take you safely to your destinations


For sceneries and charts, visit vACC Slovakia (http://vacc-slovakia.sk/)


See you in there!

The Polish VACC and VATsim Germany invite you to join the traffic between Lotnisko Chopina w Warszawie and Franz Josef Strauß Flughafen from 1730-2030z. See you there!
data.description:
Looking for variety?
Looking for full ATC?
We got something for you!


In cooperation with Poland vACC and VATsim Germany we would like to invite you every first Wednesday of the month to a City Link between Warsaw (EPWA) and Munich (EDDM). You can expect both airports staffed as well as enroute ATC between 1730 and 2030z.


Wether you fly turboprop, biz jet or airliner: this route is excellent for every type of aircraft!


We are looking forward to see you every four weeks on this relation!

data.name: VACC-Austria Weekly Wednesday
data.short_description: Weekly Wednesday - every Wednesday - 1730-2030z - FULL ATC in Austria
data.description:
Enjoy extended coverage of FULL ATC across the entire country. Take your favourite aircraft out of the hanger for a spin to our majors Vienna (LOWW) and/or the infamous Innsbruck Airport (LOWI). Alternatively enjoy a flight to our breath-taking minors: Salzburg (LOWS), Graz (LOWG), Klagenfurt (LOWK) or Linz (LOWL). Of course, we are providing full CPDLC and PDC service along the way!


Take a break from your busy schedule and enjoy an evening with 3 hours of guaranteed ATC-service "as real as it gets"! We are very excited to welcome you to one of our airports!

data.name: Stuttgart Thursday EDDS
data.short_description: Prepare for Stuttgart Thursday! No matter whether you are flying a small plane or a jet, IFR or VFR, if it flies it is welcome here.
data.description:
Prepare for Stuttgart Thursday! No matter whether you are flying a small plane or a jet, IFR or VFR, if it flies it is welcome here. From 20:00lcl to 22:00lcl (18:00z to 20:00z in the summer and 19:00z to 21:00z in the winter) there will be a mix of old stagers and new trainees controlling for you. Fly from Stuttgart over the Swabian Jura, to Lake Constance or follow the Neckar to the Rhine. As destination for your IFR-Flights we would recommend Hamburg, where RG Bremen is performing Hamburg Thursday and you can almost be sure of full ATC coverage.


Charts: https://vatsim-germany.org/pilots/aerodromes/EDDS

data.name: BVA Fly-in: Upstate New York
data.short_description: Join us on October 9th from 2-6pm ET (1800-2300z) as we venture to Upstate New York to take in the changing of the leaves from the air!
data.description:
Set the parking brake on the airliner and knock the cobwebs off your favorite general aviation aircraft! The General Aviation Fly-In visits locales across the country that are famous for their scenery and general aviation influence. While anything from a single engine Cessna to a regional jet is welcome in this event, ‘low and slow’ offers the best opportunity to experience the scenery.


During this GA Fly-In event, local air traffic control is staffed at smaller airports with overlying radar controllers to provide VFR Flight Following and IFR services. Fly VFR closed traffic, practice instrument approaches, or fly VFR or IFR between the featured airports: the choice is yours.


This weekend BVA is venturing to Upstate New York to take in the changing of the leaves from the air! Colloquially called "leaf peepers" residents of the New York City metro area venture north every year to see the leaves change. We decided we'd tag along this year.


It’s also a great time to try out one of our WINGS flights. Remember, many of the flights have published Alternate Airports, allowing you to earn your BVA pilot ratings at event airports!

"Off to Düsseldorf Monday"

data.description:
"Off to Düsseldorf Monday"


We open our training airport Düsseldorf (EDDL) from ground to center for you every week and you are cordially invited to your flight.


No matter whether you want to explore the beautiful Rhineland and Ruhr area by VFR or whether you want to start or end an IFR short, medium or long-haul flight.


Discover the versatility of the airport from a different angle and have a look.


We then hear each other on the frequency.

data.name: EDDN - Nürnberg Montag
data.short_description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week.
data.description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week. It's always a great mixture of mainly holiday-bound mid-range airliners, VFR traffic buzzing through the CTR, a bunch of cargo traffic and business as well as medical flights in smaller jets and props. Not to forget the regular military transports in larger airliners for the close-by Grafenwoehr training area. Pick up your charts, find an IFR route that suits you or just jump into your favorite flying lawnmower and explore the beautiful Franconian countryside with its tons of small airfields to choose from.

data.name: B&O Railroad FNO
data.short_description: The Baltimore and Ohio Railroad, or the B&O Railroad was the first common carrier railroad and the oldest railroad in the United States, with its first section opening in 1830. During the Civil War, the B&O Railroad served as the Union's lifeline and supply chain. At the end of 1
data.description: The Baltimore and Ohio Railroad, or the B&O Railroad was the first common carrier railroad and the oldest railroad in the United States, with its first section opening in 1830. During the Civil War, the B&O Railroad served as the Union's lifeline and supply chain. At the end of 1970, the B&O operated 5,552 miles of road and 10,449 miles of track, which connected the Great Lakes with the Chesapeake Bay. Please join ZDC, ZID, and ZOB on October 22nd from 2300z-0300z to honor the railroad that kept America moving forward.

data.name: Flight of the Living Dead
data.short_description: Shivers run up your spine! The stench and rotting smell fills the air! The dead are alive and searching for blood!! George A. Romero's infamous Night of the Living Dead was filmed in Pittsburgh and is today a cult classic. Join us on October 23rd (23-03z) at Pittsburgh (KPIT)!
data.description:
Shivers run up your spine! The stench and rotting smell fills the air! The ground disrupted and torn apart. The dead are alive, and searching for blood!!!


George A. Romero's infamous Night of the Living Dead was filmed in Pittsburgh and the surrounding areas. It's today a cult classic, and arguably one of the greatest horror films produced. It's spawned many sequels and remakes, including another famous one to Pittsburgh, Dawn of the Dead.


Join us on Saturday, October 23rd, at Pittsburgh International Airport (KPIT) as we celebrate a night of the living dead!! This event will run from 2300z to 0300z (7PM to 11PM eastern). We can't wait to see you all there!!!!!

data.name: BVA Regional Circuit: ALB, BDL, PVD
data.short_description: Join BVARTCC on October 24th from 2-5PM ET (18-21Z) for a Regional Circuit between Albany, Bradley, and Providence airports. See you there!
data.description:
In the Regional Circuit, we staff up multiple of our airports to provide pilots with an opportunity to receive 'gate-to-gate' ATC service for the duration of the event. Pilots are encouraged to fly between the airports and make the return flight if time allows; however, traffic from other airports is welcome as well. The Regional Circuit always creates an immersive atmosphere with busy frequencies and congested airways between the host airports.


This Regional Circuit features Albany (KALB), Bradley (KBDL), and Providence (KPVD).


It’s also a great time to try out one of our WINGS flights. Remember, many of the flights have published Alternate Airports, allowing you to earn your BVA pilot ratings at event airports!

data.name: Cross the Pond Eastbound
data.short_description: Cross the Pond is back for the next iteration - departing early in the North American morning and touching down in Europe ready for a Halloween party. As the evening gets underway we look forward to welcoming several hundred of you to fly transatlantic on Saturday 30 October 2021
data.description:
Cross the Pond is back for the next iteration - departing early in the North American morning and touching down in Europe ready for a Halloween party. As the evening gets underway we look forward to welcoming several hundred of you to fly transatlantic on Saturday 30 October 2021.


We have already begun to assemble our largest team ever. We look forward to involving all five Oceanic FIRs as well as aviation specialists to explain oceanic procedures, a technical team to bring more functionality and of course our regional and division airspace experts who will help us route you to your destination.


Over the course of the next months, we will be continuing to inform you through the process of selecting airfields, picking a slot and of course flying across the ocean together with hundreds of fellow VATSIM members. Stay tuned in the forum, on Twitter at @VATSIMCTP and soon on the community discord channel.

data.name: Why do Ghosts wear Clothes?
data.description: Want to find out why Ghosts wear clothes? Come fly out of Seattle, Portland, or Pasco (KSEA/KPDX/KPSC) and talk with our controllers, and they will tell you! Starting at 2300z-0300z on October 31st we will staff up for Halloween to bring you the answer! Hope to see you there!

data.description: The week has just started for most of us so it's a good time to not over-do it and refresh ourselves right away with a nice evening online as our crew at Nuremberg, EDDN is waiting for you like every week. It's always a great mixture of mainly holiday-bound mid-range airliners, VFR traffic buzzing through the CTR, a bunch of cargo traffic and business as well as medical flights in smaller jets and props. Not to forget the regular military transports in larger airliners for the close-by Grafenwoehr training area. Pick up your charts, find an IFR route that suits you or just jump into your favorite flying lawnmower and explore the beautiful Franconian countryside with its tons of small airfields to choose from.

data.name: EDDM - München Mittwoch
data.short_description: Every Wednesday from 1830z - 2130z, pilots are cordially invited to the Munich Airport (EDDM) with experienced controllers who will guide you through the Munich airspace. Whether IFR or VFR, everyone is welcome! Plan your flight, clean the cockpit windows, and off to Munich!
data.description: Welcome to our weekly "München - Mittwoch". Every Wednesday from 1830z to 2130z, all pilots are cordially invited to the Munich Airport (EDDM) with experienced controllers who will guide you safely through the Munich airspace. Whether IFR or VFR, everyone is welcome! So plan your flight, clean the cockpit windows, and off you go to Munich!

data.name: The Event Formerly Known as the Midwest FNO
data.short_description:
We've had to reschedule not once not twice but three times! But we finally bring you the event formerly known as the Midwest FNO on a Saturday!


Join the Denver, Chicago, and Minneapolis as we throw our own Monster Mash in November! Maybe a wild turkey will be seen!

data.name: Oslo Tuesday
data.short_description: Come and fly to and from Oslo-Gardermoen (ENGM)! Each second Tuesday we will be fully staffed from 17:30z to 20:00z, in addition to Polaris Control covering top-down coverage for several airports in the south-eastern part of Norway, as well as enroute service.
data.description:
Come and fly to and from Oslo-Gardermoen (ENGM)! Each second Tuesday we will be fully staffed from 17:30z to 20:00z to welcome your arrival and departures, in addition to Polaris Control covering top-down coverage for Sandefjord-Torp (ENTO), Kristiansand-Kjevik (ENCN), other airports and enroute service.


See you on the frequency!

data.name: 60 Hours of Boston Virtual ARTCC
data.short_description: Join Boston Virtual ARTCC as we staff Boston Center continuously for 60 hours throughout the weekend in November. Connect and fly, any time you want, between 11:00am ET on Friday, November 19 through 11:00pm ET on Sunday, November 21.
data.description:
Join us for this one of a kind ATC marathon event! Boston Center will be staffed continuously for 60 hours throughout the weekend in November. As part of this unique tradition, we will also be hosting Friday Night Operations (FNO) to kick off the first night of this amazing weekend. This is one of our favorite events and we look forward to talking to you all throughout the weekend of continuous ATC coverage.


There are no sign-ups or special actions required for pilots to participate: just connect and fly, any time you want, between 11:00am ET on Friday, November 19 through 11:00pm ET on Sunday, November 21. How many flights can you get in before the end of the night on Sunday?

data.name: EPWA <-> EDDM City Shuttle

routes.route: BIBAG Y133 BEPAS DCT LEGAZ DCT LAGAR DCT OKENO Q277 AGAVA

data.short_description: It's the first Wednesday of the month and time again to leave the usual domestic routes and Cross The Border! The Polish VACC and VATsim Germany invite you to join the traffic between Lotnisko Chopina w Warszawie and Franz Josef Strauß Flughafen from 1830-2130z. See you there!
data.description:
Looking for variety?
Looking for full ATC?
We got something for you!


In cooperation with Poland vACC and VATsim Germany we would like to invite you every first Wednesday of the month to a City Link between Warsaw (EPWA) and Munich (EDDM). You can expect both airports staffed as well as enroute ATC between 1830 and 2130z.


Wether you fly turboprop, biz jet or airliner: this route is excellent for every type of aircraft!


We are looking forward to see you every four weeks on this relation!

data.name: BVA Minor Facility Showcase: Bradley
data.short_description: Join BVA on December 16th from 8-11pm ET (12/17 0100-0400z) for our Minor Facility Showcase, which gives pilots the opportunity to experience one of our minor airports. This week's event features the controlled airport of Bradley (KBDL).
data.description:
BVA's Minor Facility Showcase gives pilots the opportunity to experience one of our minor airports. Local and overlying air traffic controllers will be providing service for those looking to explore the area, practice instrument approaches, arrive from afar, or just remain in the pattern. With a single focus-airport, this is the perfect opportunity to experience being sequenced at a busier airport with both IFR and VFR arrivals.


This week's event features the controlled airport of Bradley (KBDL).


It’s also a great time to try out one of our WINGS flights. Remember, many of the flights have published Alternate Airports, allowing you to earn your BVA pilot ratings at event airports!
